sp.l: By Heav'ns a lucky opportunity!
Bear her to the Royal Bed, and him to Death.

sp.speaker: Bar.
sp.l: Oh ſtay! no pow'r ſhall force me hence, till ſhe
Revive, Zaraida! Curſe on my weak Voice!
Why was't not loud as Whirl-winds, Tempeſts roar?
Oh that my Chains could ring a loud alarm.
To wake the ſleeping Gods and her! Where Father! where!
Oh that my Teeth, my Nails could ſtraitway dig
Quite through this Globe, to find the wand'ring God!
What ſhall I do to ſave her from his Luſt?
I'll wake, or cruſh her Soul out with my weight. [Ruſhes upon her.

sp.speaker: Zar.
sp.l: Oh Barnagaſſo! Am I once more here!
Thus let my Kiſſes breath my Soul into
Your Body, that we may together dye.

sp.speaker: Bar.
sp.l: Oh Love! nor Hell, nor Heav'n ſhall part us now.

sp.speaker: Emp.
sp.l: Then Earth ſhall; Guards force her from him, or Racks
Unheard of be your Fate—unbind him firſt; [He ſtruggles.
Then force her from her hold.
sp.stage: As they unbind him, he ſnatches a Sword, and holds her in his left hand.

sp.speaker: Bar.
sp.l: Now I am looſe, no Power ſhall bind my Hands again.

sp.speaker: Em.
sp.l: Curſe on my Dalliance it has ruin'd all!

sp.speaker: Bar.
sp.l: See King, my Fate is now my own; but I
Will live, live to revenge my ſelf, by Heav'ns!
'Tis ominous, 'tis the firſt time I ve graſp'd
A Manly Sword this day, this age of Slavery.

sp.speaker: Zan.
sp.l: This comes of ſlipping, when occaſion ſerves,
How e're I'm ſure of him, tho t'other lives. [Aſide.

sp.speaker: Em.
sp.l: See how amaz'd the Cowards look! ſeize him.

sp.speaker: Bar.
sp.l: Come on, I ſhall at leaſt dye nobly now.

sp.speaker: Em.
sp.l: What Noiſe is that? [Noiſe within.

sp.speaker: Off.
sp.l: Fly, Sacred Sir preſerve your Life;
The General enrag'd at his Repulſe,
Has, with a Rebell's Fury, forc'd our Gates,
None dare oppoſe; my ſelf but hardly ſcap'd
The rolling Flood, to warn you of the War.

sp.speaker: Bar.
sp.l: Oh my brave Friend! How have I wrong'd thy honeſty▪

sp.speaker: Em.
sp.l: In vain is Flight; I muſt ſuſtain the ſhock.

div.stage: Enter Barſiloa, &c.

sp.speaker: Gen.
sp.l: Fall on, fall on; I have not time to Embrace
Thee now, anon I ſhall; let us diſpatch.

sp.speaker: Bar.
sp.l: Come, Love, inſpire my Heart, while I engage
This Emperour! cruel; and Coward too!

div.stage: They Fight, beat the Emperour off, and clear the Stage.
Re-Enter the Emperour, Zanhaga, and 2 Guards, as in Flight.

sp.speaker: Em.
sp.l: Ha! they have play'd me foul; I feel, beſides
My Wounds, a Murdering Enemy within:
The boyling Caldron roars, barb'd Irons prick
My tender'ſt part; bear me to th' Briny-Flood,
There let me plunge this Flaxen Taper down;
Wade through the dark Abyſs to quench my Blaze.

sp.speaker: Zan.
sp.l: Help me to bear him up.

sp.speaker: Em.
sp.l: Wide, wide Earth! burſt ope thy chilling womb!
In thy cold Ciſterns let me bathe my Flame;
Build me a Throne in Aquilunda's Pool;
Turn here the Zaira's courſe, I'll gape awide,
Through me it's Channel lyes; it ſhall come forth
Swift liquid Flame, painted with my Hearts-blood.

sp.speaker: Zan.
sp.l: Truſt me, I weep to ſee my Maſter thus.

sp.speaker: Em.
sp.l: That I could cleave to Hell! dig in rich Mines.
Of Winter! I'd feed on Cakes of Ice.
The Subterranean Field ſhould hiſs, ſhould ſlame,
Ev'n Snow ſhould burn; ſo catching is my Plague!
Off! I'll to Hell, the happyeſt Heaven is Hell.

sp.speaker: Zan.
sp.l: How cold he feels: Emp. I have my wiſh, I freeze.
But here Zaraida comes, 'ſt not a word;
She takes me for her Lord; Who is't dares hold me?

Barnagaſſo here! Dye fond Fool.
[Stabs Zan.
Now I'm King again! let Trumpets ſound!
For Mighty Jamoan, Great Tombu, Lives.
Ha! What haſt thou done! Kill d thy beſt Friends.

sp.speaker: Zan.
sp.l: Mourn not, for I've been before-hand with you:
Know, 'twas I Poyſon'd you to gain your Crown:
I Brib'd the Prieſt, to give the Pris'ner Death,
That I might wear a Triple Diadem.
I can't repent, were it to do again,
And the Temptation half ſo fair, I'd do't.
Make haſt, you cannot live,
I'll wait rhee at the Portal. [Dyes.

sp.speaker: Emp.
sp.l: I ſhall o'rtake thee e're thou fly'ſt ſo far;
Curs'd Zanhaga! my Blood will weigh thee down:
Oh Love! prepare my Starry Throne;
My Soul is wing'd, and as my Body ſinks, ſhe mounts. [Dyes.

sp.speaker: Bar.
sp.l: This way th'aſtoniſh'd King retir'd; behold [Seeing them.
Triumphant Death! How were theſe murders done?

sp.speaker: Offi.
sp.l: The King was Poyſon'd, as Zanhaga, e're
His Death Confeſs'd, by him, he too had brib'd
The Prieſt to ſpeak your Fate; the King depriv'd
Of Reaſon, by the Operating Draught,
Miſtaking him for you, deſtroy'd him.

sp.speaker: Bar.
sp.l: They ſhould have fall'n by me alone, but I
Submit to th' Will of Heav'n, take hence the Dead.
I cannot, muſt not pity 'em, and 'tis
Not in my Nature to Inſult, to you
Who with your timely aid maintain'd what I
Begun, I give my Thanks in this Embrace,
And, as the next of Blood, ſalute you Tombu's King.

sp.speaker: Gen:
sp.l: 'Tis in your Love I glory more, than in
My Crown, which ſo ignobly does deſcend;
My Fathers crimes have made me great; I fought
Not to be King, but to relieve ſo brave
A Man, to be your Friend, I've not deſerv'd

That Name, yet I'll aſſume it thus.
Embraces Bar.

sp.speaker: Zar.
sp.l: 'Twere vain to offer at a payment of
Our debts to Heav'n, which had reduc'd us to
The worſt Extreams, and ſnatcht us thence to joys
Unthought of, unexpected bliſs; Heav'n has
Appear'd ſo partial for our good, that 'twere
A Sin to doubt its further care; ev'n our
Misfortunes ſeem but the kind Tryals of
A pious mind, our grief, a purging flame;
And now all Innocent we'll live, moſt bleſt.

sp.speaker: Bar.
sp.l: Moſt bleſt indeed in my Zaraida's Love, [Embraceing her.
What wonders were for our Deliv'rance wrought!
Let none hereafter at misfortunes pine,
Let none deſpair, that hear our ſtory told;
Let each unhappy Man his Miſery
With patience bear, for Heav'n at laſt will ſet him Free.
